intro: Acianthus borealis, commonly known as the northern acianthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Arctic regions of North America and Eurasia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of white and purple, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. Acianthus borealis plays a vital role in Arctic ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various pollinators and small mammals.
